setting.name: Modem VID
setting.description: Set/read radio modem Vendor Identification Number (VID). Only radio modems with matching VIDs can communicate with each other. 0xFFFF means to use factory value.

setting.name: Hopping Channel
setting.description: Set/read spread spectrum channel on which modem communicates. Separate channels minimize interference between multiple sets of modems operating in the same vicinity.

setting.name: Mac Retries
setting.description: Set/read maximum number of Mac level RF packet delivery attempts of unicasts. If RR is non-zero packets sent from the radio will request an acknowledgement, and can be resent up to RR times if no acknowledgements are received.

setting.name: Multi-Transmit
setting.description: Set/read number of additional broadcast retransmissions. All broadcast packets are transmitted MT+1 times to ensure it is received.

setting.name: Broadcast Radius
setting.description: Set/Read the transmission radius for broadcast data transmissions. Set to 0 for maximum radius. If BH is set greater than NH then the value of NH is used.

setting.name: Mesh Retries
setting.description: Set/read maximum number of network packet delivery attempts. If MR is non-zero, packets sent will request a network acknowledgement, and can be resent up to MR times if no acknowledgements are received.

setting.name: Network Hops
setting.description: Set/read maximum number of hops across the network. This number doesn't limit # of hops; rather, it is used to calculate maximum network traversal time and must be set the same on all nodes in the network.

setting.name: Network Delay Slots
setting.description: Set/read the maximum number of delay slots before rebroadcasting a network packet.

setting.name: Coordinator Enable
setting.description: Set/read the network type. End Device won't propogate broadcasts and won't become an intermediate node on a route.

setting.name: TX Power Level
setting.description: Select transmit power level. Note that the modem requires 5 VDC supply (or greater) for full 1 Watt output power. If supply voltage is less than 5V, the radio will transmit at the highest power level possible and set a warning flag.

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: Read high 32 bits of modems unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address.

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: Read low 32 bits of modems unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address.

setting.name: Destination Address High
setting.description: Set/read the upper 32 bits of the 64 bit destination extended address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address.

setting.name: Destination Address Low
setting.description: Set/read the lower 32 bits of the 64 bit destination extended address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address.

setting.name: Node Identifier
setting.description: Set/read Node Identifier string

setting.name: Node Discovery Backoff
setting.description: Set/read Node Discovery backoff register. This sets the maximum delay for Node Discovery responses to be sent (ND, DN).

setting.name: Node Discovery Options
setting.description: Sets the node discovery options bitfield. Options include 0x01 - Append DD value to end of node discovery, 0x02 - Return devices own ND response first, 0x04 - Return RSSI value of the ND broadcast received by the responding node.

setting.name: Device Type Identifier
setting.description: Set/read the device type identifier value. This can be used to differentiate multiple XBee-based products.

setting.name: Encryption Enable
setting.description: Enable or disable 128-bit AES encryption.

setting.name: AES Encryption Key
setting.description: Sets the 128-bit key used for encryption and decryption. This register cannot be read.

category.name: Serial Interfacing
category.description: Configure serial (UART) interface and I/O line options

setting.name: Baud Rate
setting.description: Select serial interface rate (speed for data transfer between radio modem and host). Values from 0-8 select preset standard rates. Values at 0x39 and above select actual baud rate. Serial data rate does not have to match the RF data rate which is adjustable using the BR command. If the serial data rate is set higher than the RF data rate, CTS may need to be observed to prevent DI buffer overrun.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: Configure parity for the UART.

setting.name: Stop Bits
setting.description: Configure the number of stop bits for the UART.

setting.name: Packetization Threshold
setting.description: Set/read character threshold. RF transmission is begun after receiving RB bytes, or after receiving at least 1 byte and seeing RO character times of silence on the UART.

setting.name: Packetization Timeout
setting.description: Set/read number of character times of inter-character delay required before transmission begins. Set to zero to transmit characters as they arrive instead of buffering them into one RF packet.

setting.name: GPO1 Configuration
setting.description: Select behavior of Pin 9 of XTend Module, (CTS on DB9).

setting.name: GPI1 Configuration
setting.description: Select function for Pin 10 of XTend Module, (RTS on DB9).

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: Set/read the flow control threshold. De-assert CTS and/or send XOFF when FT bytes are in the UART receive buffer.

setting.name: GPO2 Configuration
setting.description: Select behavior of Pin 3 of XTend module, (DCD & DSR on DB9).

setting.name: API Enable
setting.description: Packet mode API formats frames into packets from the RF link to the serial port. It expects serial port packets to be formatted and transmits as a packet over the RF link.

setting.name: API Options
setting.description: Sets the API data frame type output format for received frames.

setting.name: AT Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: Set/read command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, modem returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: Set required period of silence before, after and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: Set/read character value to be used to break from data mode to command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character.

category.name: Diagnostics
category.description: Commands used for displaying modem status information

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read module firmware version number

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Read module hardware version number

setting.name: Received Signal Strength
setting.description: Read signal level of last good packet received (RSSI) in dB (reports absolute value, eg. -88dBm = 0x58, accurate between -40 dBm to RX sensitivity).

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: Set/read duration of PWM (pulse width modulated) output on pin 11. The PWM output encodes fade margin (RX signal strength relative to RX sensitivity) by varying the duty cycle of a 125Hz square wave.

setting.name: Board Temperature
setting.description: Read current temperature of module in degrees Celsius (8-bit twos-complement, eg. 26C = 0x1A, -10C = 0xF6).

setting.name: Board Voltage
setting.description: Read supply voltage to module (VCC) multiplied by 65536 (eg. 5.02V = 5.02*65536 = 0x5051F, maximum of 5 digits returned).

setting.name: Receive Error Count
setting.description: Set/read number of RF Packets rejected because of bit errors in packet.

setting.name: Receive Good Count
setting.description: Set/read number of RF Packets successfully received.

setting.name: Delivery Failure Count
setting.description: Read number of RF packets sent where retries expire with no ACK received (when RR>0)

setting.name: Configuration Code
setting.description: Read the configuration code associated with the current AT command configuration.

setting.name: Maximum Number of RF Payload Bytes
setting.description: Read the maximum number of RF payload bytes that can be sent in a single RF transmission.
